title: How to Choose Garage Doors

steps.headline: Select the traditional steel door if you want something economical.
steps.description: Not only are steel doors economical, they are also very durable. They are dent resistant doors that are very low maintenance, requiring upkeep every 10 to 15 years. The cost of a steel door ranges from $300 to $500 USD.

steps.headline: Choose a vinyl door if you live in a humid environment.
steps.description: Vinyl doors are rust resistant, making them ideal for homes located near the ocean or in a humid environment. Like steel doors, vinyl doors are also dent resistant. Because vinyl doors never need to be painted, they are even more low maintenance than steel doors. The cost of a vinyl door ranges from $300 to $500 USD.

steps.headline: Pick an aluminum door if you want a contemporary look.
steps.description: If you live in a contemporary home and are looking for a complementary garage door, look no further than the aluminum door. Aluminum doors are also low maintenance garage doors. Additionally, aluminum doors are a great choice if you are looking for a door to brighten up the inside of your garage. Aluminum doors are also rust resistant.

steps.headline: Try a wooden garage door if you want something charming.
steps.description: Wooden garage doors will give your house a natural, warm feel. However, wooden garage doors are high maintenance when compared to steel, vinyl, and aluminum doors. They require staining and painting every few years to prevent rot, mold, and cracking. Wooden garage doors tend to be more expensive as well, ranging from $500 to $1,000 USD.

steps.headline: Go for the traditional garage door.
steps.description: Traditional garage doors are typically aluminum with raised panels. They are the most versatile of the three styles. Traditional garage doors match almost every type of home design. Choose this style if you are going for a simple look that will match any home design.

steps.headline: Choose the carriage house garage door if you want a rustic look.
steps.description: Carriage-style doors are reminiscent of a carriage house. Their appearance is similar to the appearance of barn doors. Pick a carriage-style door if your home has a countryside or rural feel.

steps.headline: Pick the contemporary-style garage door if you want a modern look.
steps.description: Contemporary garage doors have simple, clean lines that will complement a modern house design. They are typically made up of aluminum and glass panels. Additionally, the glass panels will allow light to come into your garage. If you plan to use your garage as a studio or workshop, go for this style.

steps.headline: Choose short-raised panels.
steps.description: Short-raised panels have a square-like shape. They give garage doors depth and character. They go great with Victorian or colonial-style homes. Short raised panels also complement a Tudor home’s strong architectural lines.

steps.headline: Pick long-raised panels.
steps.description: Long-raised panels have a more rectangular shape when compared to short-raised panels. Like short-raised panels, they give garage doors depth and distinction. Long-raised panels go with a variety of home architectural styles.

steps.headline: Try a flush panel design if you want a garage door that doesn’t stand out.
steps.description: Because flush panels are flat, garage doors with flush panels tend to blend into the surrounding wall area. Flush panels are also slightly textured.

steps.headline: Select glass panels if you want a contemporary door.
steps.description: The type of glass you choose depends on how much light you want to come in through the door. You can also choose how many window panels per section you want.

steps.headline: Pick single-layer doors if you want something economical.
steps.description: Like their name, single-layer doors are composed of a single sheet of steel or vinyl. Single-layer doors are a great option if your garage isn’t attached to your home, or if you only plan to use your garage for storage or to park your car. The cost of single-layer doors can range from $300 to $500 USD.

steps.headline: Choose double-layer doors for added insulation.
steps.description: Double-layer doors are composed of steel or vinyl with an added layer of polystyrene or polyurethane. The added layer of insulation can increase energy efficiency. It provides sound protection as well. Choose this option if your garage is attached to your house or if you use your garage as a laundry room. Because polyurethane is an expansive foam, it provides more insulation than polystyrene. The cost of double-layer doors can range from $700 to $1,000 USD.

steps.headline: Select triple-layer doors for the most insulation.
steps.description: Triple-layer doors are like double-layer doors, except they have an added layer of steel or vinyl on the inside of the door. The added layer of steel or vinyl makes these doors the most insulated, soundproof doors of all garage doors. Choose triple-layer doors if you plan to use your garage as an extra space like an office, studio, or workshop. Triple-layer doors are also a great choice if you live in an area with extreme temperatures. The cost of triple-layer doors can range from $1,500 to $3,000 USD.

text: Choosing the Material Select the traditional steel door if you want something economical. Not only are steel doors economical, they are also very durable. They are dent resistant doors that are very low maintenance, requiring upkeep every 10 to 15 years. The cost of a steel door ranges from $300 to $500 USD. Choose a vinyl door if you live in a humid environment. Vinyl doors are rust resistant, making them ideal for homes located near the ocean or in a humid environment. Like steel doors, vinyl doors are also dent resistant. Because vinyl doors never need to be painted, they are even more low maintenance than steel doors. The cost of a vinyl door ranges from $300 to $500 USD. Pick an aluminum door if you want a contemporary look. If you live in a contemporary home and are looking for a complementary garage door, look no further than the aluminum door. Aluminum doors are also low maintenance garage doors. Additionally, aluminum doors are a great choice if you are looking for a door to brighten up the inside of your garage. Aluminum doors are also rust resistant. Try a wooden garage door if you want something charming. Wooden garage doors will give your house a natural, warm feel. However, wooden garage doors are high maintenance when compared to steel, vinyl, and aluminum doors. They require staining and painting every few years to prevent rot, mold, and cracking. Wooden garage doors tend to be more expensive as well, ranging from $500 to $1,000 USD. Picking a Style Go for the traditional garage door. Traditional garage doors are typically aluminum with raised panels. They are the most versatile of the three styles. Traditional garage doors match almost every type of home design. Choose this style if you are going for a simple look that will match any home design. Choose the carriage house garage door if you want a rustic look. Carriage-style doors are reminiscent of a carriage house. Their appearance is similar to the appearance of barn doors. Pick a carriage-style door if your home has a countryside or rural feel. Pick the contemporary-style garage door if you want a modern look. Contemporary garage doors have simple, clean lines that will complement a modern house design. They are typically made up of aluminum and glass panels. Additionally, the glass panels will allow light to come into your garage. If you plan to use your garage as a studio or workshop, go for this style. Thinking about Panel Designs Choose short-raised panels. Short-raised panels have a square-like shape. They give garage doors depth and character. They go great with Victorian or colonial-style homes. Short raised panels also complement a Tudor home’s strong architectural lines. Pick long-raised panels. Long-raised panels have a more rectangular shape when compared to short-raised panels. Like short-raised panels, they give garage doors depth and distinction. Long-raised panels go with a variety of home architectural styles. Try a flush panel design if you want a garage door that doesn’t stand out. Because flush panels are flat, garage doors with flush panels tend to blend into the surrounding wall area. Flush panels are also slightly textured. Select glass panels if you want a contemporary door. The type of glass you choose depends on how much light you want to come in through the door. You can also choose how many window panels per section you want. Choosing Insulation Pick single-layer doors if you want something economical. Like their name, single-layer doors are composed of a single sheet of steel or vinyl. Single-layer doors are a great option if your garage isn’t attached to your home, or if you only plan to use your garage for storage or to park your car. The cost of single-layer doors can range from $300 to $500 USD. Choose double-layer doors for added insulation. Double-layer doors are composed of steel or vinyl with an added layer of polystyrene or polyurethane. The added layer of insulation can increase energy efficiency. It provides sound protection as well. Choose this option if your garage is attached to your house or if you use your garage as a laundry room. Because polyurethane is an expansive foam, it provides more insulation than polystyrene. The cost of double-layer doors can range from $700 to $1,000 USD. Select triple-layer doors for the most insulation. Triple-layer doors are like double-layer doors, except they have an added layer of steel or vinyl on the inside of the door. The added layer of steel or vinyl makes these doors the most insulated, soundproof doors of all garage doors. Choose triple-layer doors if you plan to use your garage as an extra space like an office, studio, or workshop. Triple-layer doors are also a great choice if you live in an area with extreme temperatures. The cost of triple-layer doors can range from $1,500 to $3,000 USD.
